parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.5</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global</value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns marker size. This command is identical to [[getMarkerSize]]. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''markerSize''' markerName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> markerName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - in format [a-axis, b-axis], where:
* a-axis: [[Number]] - 1/2 width of marker
* b-axis: [[Number]] - 1/2 height of marker </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_mSize = [[markerSize]] "Marker1";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setMarkerSize]], [[setMarkerSizeLocal]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>
